intro: Spergella glabra, commonly known as the smooth spergola, is a small, annual herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas or along the edges of wetlands. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a smooth texture, which gives it its common name. Spergella glabra is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
